results.title: Single Mega Millions Ticket Wins $1.34 Billion as Jackpot Grows
results.abstract: The total rose again Saturday, but it was not yet known who bought the $2 ticket in Illinois that matched all five winning numbers and the Mega Ball — 67, 45, 57, 36, 13 and 14.

media.caption: A Mega Millions lottery ticket at a 7-Eleven convenience store in Chino Hills, Calif., on Thursday.

results.adx_keywords: Condoms;Decisions and Verdicts;Sex Crimes;Suits and Litigation (Civil);Supreme Court of Canada;Canada
results.title: Breaking Agreement to Use a Condom Is a Sex Crime, Canada High Court Rules
results.abstract: The Supreme Court ruling is one of the strictest in a recent spate of measures addressing deceptive condom use, as courts try to define consent.

media.caption: Canada’s Supreme Court has ruled that removing a condom during sexual intercourse without getting explicit permission is a crime.

results.adx_keywords: Oil (Petroleum) and Gasoline;Standard & Poor's 500-Stock Index;Company Reports;Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Biden, Joseph R Jr;Exxon Mobil Corp;Chevron Corporation;United States
results.title: Exxon and Chevron Report Record Profits on High Oil and Gas Prices
results.abstract: The energy industry’s windfall followed a spike in prices, resulting mostly from Russia’s invasion of Ukraine and the global economic rebound from the coronavirus pandemic.

media.caption: The oil giants’ earnings reports come as consumers are enduring the pain of high gas prices.

results.adx_keywords: Parechovirus;Viruses;Babies and Infants;Centers for Disease Control and Prevention;Tennessee
results.title: Parechovirus Sickened 23 Infants in Nashville, C.D.C. Says
results.abstract: The common pathogen frequently produces the mild symptoms of a cold, but it can cause severe illness and death in babies under 3 months old, health officials say, warning doctors to be vigilant.
org_facet: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

media.caption: The 23 children admitted to the Nashville hospital — Monroe Carell Jr. Children’s Hospital at Vanderbilt University — were between 5 days and 3 months old, the C.D.C. said.

results.title: Feeling Dismissed? How to Spot ‘Medical Gaslighting’ and What to Do About It.
results.abstract: Experts share tips on advocating for yourself in a health care setting.

results.byline: By Mike Ives and Ava Sasani
results.title: In Flood-Stricken Kentucky, the Search for Victims Intensifies
results.abstract: As the weather cleared temporarily in the state’s eastern region, rescuers worked with aircraft, boats and vehicles to reach those stranded.

results.adx_keywords: Golf;Trump, Donald J;LIV Golf;Trump National Golf Club (Bedminster, NJ)
results.title: Watching Trump Play Golf: Decent Drives, Skipped Putts, Lots of Sweat
results.abstract: The former president’s barge-ahead style and whim for scooping up shots too hard to make wouldn’t fly on the LIV Golf series, which his Bedminster club is hosting this weekend.

media.caption: Donald J. Trump played in a pro-am tournament on the eve of a LIV Golf event at his club in Bedminster, N.J.

results.adx_keywords: News and News Media;Cable Television;Presidential Election of 2024;United States Politics and Government;Trump, Donald J;Murdoch, Rupert;Fox News Channel
results.title: Fox News, Once Home to Trump, Now Often Ignores Him
results.abstract: The former president hasn’t been interviewed on the Rupert Murdoch-owned cable network in more than 100 days, and other Republicans often get the attention he once did.

media.caption: Former President Donald Trump appearing on Fox News in 2020. He has complained to associates about how little coverage the network has recently given him.

results.title: Women, the Game Is Rigged. It’s Time We Stop Playing by the Rules.
results.abstract: It’s hard to ignore the fact that empowerment feminism hasn’t really delivered on its promises.

results.byline: By Annie Karni and Julian E. Barnes
results.title: House Passes Assault Weapons Ban That Is Doomed in Senate
results.abstract: Coming on the heels of a spate of mass shootings, the vote gave Democrats another opportunity to draw a sharp distinction with Republicans before the midterm elections.

media.caption: A memorial outside Robb Elementary School in Uvalde, Texas. A previous ban on assault weapons expired in 2004 and has never been renewed.
media.copyright: Tamir Kalifa for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Oceans and Seas;Fish and Other Marine Life;Volcanoes;National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration;Atlantic Ocean;Azores Islands
results.title: There Are Holes on the Ocean Floor. Scientists Don’t Know Why.
results.abstract: Similar openings on the sea floor were first spotted 18 years ago along the Mid-Atlantic Ridge. Their origins remain unknown. Scientists are asking the public for their thoughts.

media.caption: While researchers explored the Mid-Atlantic Ridge on July 23, they noticed sets of holes in the sediment that they couldn’t explain. The laser points in the image are 10 centimeters. or about 4 inches, apart.

results.title: The Dog Lawyer Doesn’t Care That You Hate Him
results.abstract: In defending dogs at all costs, Richard Rosenthal has made a lot of enemies. But his animal clients owe him their lives.

media.caption: Richard Rosenthal, with his greyhounds Bugsy and Louis, has made a specialty of defending dangerous dogs.
media.copyright: Johnny Milano for The New York Times

results.title: What Psychologists Want Today’s Young Adults to Know

results.title: As Ukraine defends in the east and south, a U.S. official says Russia’s war effort is failing.

results.title: The Country That Wants to ‘Be Average’ vs. Jeff Bezos and His $500 Million Yacht
results.abstract: Why did Rotterdam stand between one of the world’s richest men and his boat? The furious response is rooted in Dutch values.

media.caption: The Hef Bridge, in Rotterdam, Netherlands, was decommissioned as a railroad bridge in the early 1990s. A request to briefly dismantle the middle span was withdrawn in the face of protests.

results.abstract: The hit play, closed since January, was expected to reopen on Broadway this fall.

results.title: Which City Is Most Expensive for Renters? You Might Be Surprised.
